result.rationale: This species, although still common in the highlands of the Maroni, Mana and Commewijne rivers of Suriname and French Guiana, faces increasing fishing pressure, as well as habitat destruction by gold miners. There are continuing declines in habitat and population size, and four locations, based on these threats. It has an extent of occurrence (EOO) best estimated at 13,569 km<sup>2</sup> and an area of occupancy (AOO) best estimated at under 2,000 km<sup>2</sup>. Therefore, this species is assessed as Vulnerable.
result.geographicrange: This species occurs in the Maroni, Mana and Commewijne rivers of Suriname and French Guiana. The type locality is rapids upstream of the Litany River at Antecume Pata village, 3°18'06.4"N, 54°04'54.1"W, Maroni River system, French Guiana (Jégu et al. 2002).
result.population: It is estimated that the total population probably exceeds 10,000 individuals, but is decreasing because of overfishing and habitat destruction.
result.habitat: This species lives in upland rapids of black and clearwater rivers where Podostemacea plants (the main food) grow on the rapids.
result.threats: Habitat destruction from gold mining and overfishing are the main threats faced by this species.
result.conservationmeasures: There are no specific measures protecting this species, but it does occur in some protected areas.
result.usetrade: This species is much sought after as food.
